intro: Eremobium lineare, commonly known as the linear eremobium, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Amaryllidaceae family and is characterized by its narrow, strap-like leaves. The plant produces clusters of white to pale blue flowers that bloom in summer. It is often cultivated for its ornamental value and adaptability to dry conditions. Eremobium lineare prefers well-drained soil and full sun exposure.
